content: Compared to first quarter, our second quarter gross margin increased by 350 basis points sequentially to 59.1%, mainly due to a more favorable foreign exchange rate, cost improvement and value selling. So I think, Randy, the first part -- his first question is in looking at TSMC's third quarter guidance and also looking at our full year growth to be mid-30s. Well, let me answer the question. Operator can we move on to the next participant, please. Thank you very much. Operator can we move on to the next participant, please. Well, let me answer the question. And for TSMC, because our technology position is much stronger today and we also have a very strong portfolio in HPC and we have a long-term strategic relationship with customer, so we see 2023, even just inventory correction, is still a growth year for TSMC. Thank you very much. Operator can we move on to the next participant, please. Operator can we move on to the next participant, please. Thank you very much. Well, let me answer the question. Thank you very much. Thank you very much. Well, Frank's second question is with pricing, will -- could there be a situation where customers, I guess, will pull in more of their business to second half of this year, and thus, we would see a weaker first half next year.
